result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel D Townsend was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Samuel D Townsend is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Samuel D Townsend was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Samuel D Townsend was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge remitted. $343  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Counseling as recommended.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
$343  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 3.

AMENDED SIGNATURE BOND - CONDITIONS MODIFIED
DEFENDANT IS ALLOWED TO LEAVE WISCONSIN WHILE ON BAIL MONITORING AUGUST 1 - 3, 2014 TO ATTEND A FAMILY REUNION IN ST LOUIS, MO WITH HIS WIFE AND CHILDREN.
Court orders a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 AM on the business day following his/her release from jail.
  - Defendant shall commit no acts or threats of violence toward Shalonda T.
  - Defendant shall be allowed contact with Shalonda T. , if and when sobrietor is in place.
  - Defendant shall have no contact, direct or indirect, with Michelle S.
  - Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
Crt orders that def shall be allowed to leave Wisconsin while on BMP Aug 1-3, 2014.
